action.primary: Powerfully unblocks the channels and extinguishes Wind

indications: Chronic Wind-Dampness with numbness and weakness of the limbs and cramping of the sinews
This herb is generally used for stubborn cases
Dermatosis, numbness of the skin or any kind of rash

action.primary: Dispels Wind from the sinews and settles jitteriness and convulsions

indications: Any kind of spasms, tremors or seizures.
Facial paralysis, aphasia and hemiplegia due to Wind-Stroke

contraindications: Use caution for those with Yin Deficiency.
Use caution for those with Dry Blood.
Use caution for those with Wind from Blood Deficiency.
interactions: Use with caution for patients taking anticoagulants such as heparin, warfarin (Coumadin) and enoxaparin (Lovenox) or antiplatelet drugs such as aspirin, dipyridamole (Persantine) and clopidogrel (Plavix) as concurrent use may have an additive or synergistic effect.

useCases: Joint pain, weakness and stiffness due to Wind-Dampness
Chronic Bi syndrome with severe spasms, pain or numbness
As a medicinal liquor for facial paralysis or hemiplegia due to Wind-Stroke
Bi syndrome due to Wind and Dampness
Post-stroke complications such as muscle paralysis and hemiplegia

notes: This herb is very effective at expelling Wind that has accumulated at the Blood level.
It is said to penetrate the bone tissue to expel Wind and alleviate convulsions.
It is an essential substance for the treatment of Wind arthralgia, convulsions, scabies and malignant scabies because it travels all over, both inwardly and outwardly.
The nose of most snakes grow downward, but the nose of this snake grows upward.
Agkistrodon Qi She is sometimes used as a substitute for Bai Hua She as they are very similar.
This herb has been shown to have an antagonistic effect on cancer cells.

Both Bai Hua She and Zaocys #{WuShaoShe} Wu Shao She dispel Wind, unblock the collaterals, settle jitteriness, and stop convulsions and are often used together to treat Wind-Damp Bi, itchy skin and convulsions. Wu Shao She is not toxic and its effects are somewhat milder and more harmonious. It governs Wind in the Kidneys while Bai Hua She governs wind in the Lungs.
Bungarus Bai Hua She is similar to Agkistrodon but more potent. Some consider it more potent for Wind disorders with itching
This substance is also said to strengthen sinews and bones.
Processed Bungarus Zhi Bai Hua She does not smell as bad and is stronger. It is also safer for use in the clinic with a better effect.
